Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

New evidence is constantly being analyzed.=C2=A0 But, as I said, the eviden=
ce I have checked out was not convincing. And yes, this is evidence "per se=
".=C2=A0 As you put it, it is evidence of "something that should not be the=
re".=C2=A0 And my point is, all of this evidence I have heard, is evidence =
of something that is completely reasonable to be there: noise and radio bro=
adcasts.

And I still don't understand why those who analyze evidence (pick=
ing it apart, as you call it), you feel must be name called, insulted, and =
referred to as a "clown", because they are skeptical of these claims, and d=
ecide not to simply believe the claims.

But critical thinking is just thin=
king logically.=C2=A0 If someone presents claims, and includes a=C2=A0=C2=
=A0 disclaimer about not being allowed to think logically when viewing the =
evidence, I'm afraid it would not be unexpected for those claims to be ridi=
culed.=C2=A0 Maybe that is why you have such bad experiences when presentin=
g your findings?

There is no need for there to be such friction between EV=
P researchers, and skeptics.=C2=A0 As long as each group could agree that t=
he basis for analyzing evidence is to be allowed to think logically.


--- =
On Mon, 3/29/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

rank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Parano=
rmal Investigation Into 2012 Via Ghost Box  EVP Part 2 [1 Attachment]

VP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, March 29, 2010, 8:43 AM







=C2=A0
=



  


    
      
              
        [Attachment(s) from Frank Sumpti=
on included below]
        
      
      =C2=A0So where's your evidence, yo=
ur recordings? Let me guess, they're being analyzed. I didn't start this th=
read. just chimming in that I get similar voices. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0This ain't =
evidence per se`, as the source is unknown, all we can do is present what w=
e get. I've alwasy said there's something that talks that shouldn't be ther=
e, and that's all. You can't know who it is, or what it is, that doesn't ma=
ke it useless. But as soon as we present what we get there's always some cl=
own that wants to pick it apart and try to take away all meaning and experi=
ence. So if you want critcial thinking and consistent evidence go hang out=
=C2=A0on JREF. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S


On Mon, Mar 29, 2010 at 8:05 AM, Rj <ra=
sterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 







You say the 'bitch' comes out wh=
en you feel you're being spoken down to, yet you start threads on you own (=
like this one) where you attack those who hold different opinions than your=
s, but who have said nothing against you.=C2=A0 Skeptic simply means not be=
lieving things just because someone claims it.=C2=A0 Anyone on the internet=
 who is NOT a skeptic is in danger of losing a lot of money to Nigerian ban=
kers.


No testing I've ever seen, whether my own or from others, has shown=
 me results that could be shown to only have come from some paranormal enti=
ties.=C2=A0 That is, while one could claim it did, there was nothing about =
it that also couldn't be explained as coming from just the misinterpretatio=
n of noise, or of random radio broadcast snippets.=C2=A0 And so I see no re=
ason to explain the results by claiming they come from ghosts or aliens whe=
n a more mundane explanation works just as well.=C2=A0 Well one reason mayb=
e: its more fun to believe.


Many people who claim a more exotic explanati=
on also, curiously, claim it can't be tested or verified.=C2=A0 While those=
 who claim it is based on personal interpretation of noise and random broad=
cast, can and do test that theory just fine.=C2=A0 Again, this could be exp=
lained by some incredibly complex system of ghost-rules where ghosts aren't=
 allowed to communicate in good grammar, and are required to make only bad =
predictions or spew irrelevant comments, or must perform poorly only when b=
eing tested.=C2=A0 Or it could be explained simply by accepting that the te=
sts are good, and that it is the claims being=C2=A0 tested that are bogus.=
=C2=A0=C2=A0 I think it takes a lot of dancing to believe the former over t=
he latter.


Again, being skeptical means not simply accepting=C2=A0 claims=
, especially unusual ones, without some critical thinking and investigation=
.=C2=A0 It doesn't mean that the claims deserve to be rejected outright, ju=
st as it doesn't mean rejecting everything we know about history and scienc=
e.=C2=A0 There is nothing wrong with demanding evidence of unusual claims.=
=C2=A0 But not just evidence: good evidence, evidence gathered under contro=
lled conditions.=C2=A0 Personal claims about ghosts are not good evidence.=
=C2=A0 Recordings that can only be understood once someone is first told wh=
at they are supposed to hear, is not good evidence.=C2=A0 The only good evi=
dence we have are the claims where the recordings are said to predict somet=
hing: and then that something doesn't happen.=C2=A0 Unfortunately, that is =
good evidence that this is just random sounds, not that their is any intell=
igence lying to us.


Notice also, that if I am a skeptic, I do not need to=
 call those who are not skeptical, or are convinced that their are ghosts o=
n their radio, names or other insulting things.=C2=A0 I do not feel the nee=
d to be defensive, because I have nothing to defend.=C2=A0 I just ask for, =
look for, and wait for, better evidence.=C2=A0 Nothing would make me happie=
r to find proof of an afterlife, beyond just claims and televangelists and =
shows on tv.=C2=A0 That's why I comment about claims of proof that I don't =
think hold water. Because I think real proof is important.=C2=A0 And bogus =
proof is the primary obstacle to finding the good stuff.

that it can be shared, so you have to prove it to yourself. 


The bitch co=
mes out when I think I'm being talked down to. You speak like a typical ske=
ptic, demanding evidence and accepting none, nor doing your own damn home w=
ork and testing for your self. 

F-S

<td va=
lign=3D"top">You say the 'bitch' comes out when you feel you're being spoke=
n down to, yet you start threads on you own (like this one) where you attac=
k those who hold different opinions than yours, but who have said nothing a=
gainst you.  Skeptic simply means not believing things just because so=
meone claims it.  Anyone on the internet who is NOT a skeptic is in da=
nger of losing a lot of money to Nigerian bankers.<br>
<br>No testing I've =
ever seen, whether my own or from others, has shown me results that could b=
e shown to only have come from some paranormal entities.  That is, whi=
le one could claim it did, there was nothing about it that also couldn't be=
 explained as coming from just the misinterpretation of noise, or of random=
 radio broadcast snippets.  And so I see no reason to explain the resu=
lts by claiming they come from ghosts or aliens when a more mundane explana=
tion works just as well.  Well one reason maybe: its more fun to belie=
ve.<br>
<br>Many people who claim a more exotic explanation also, curiously=
, claim it can't be tested or verified.  While those who claim it is b=
ased on personal interpretation of noise and random broadcast, can and do t=
est that theory just fine.  Again, this could be explained by some inc=
redibly complex system of ghost-rules where ghosts aren't allowed to commun=
icate in good grammar, and are required to make only bad predictions or spe=
w irrelevant comments, or must perform poorly only when being tested. =
 Or it could be explained simply by accepting that the tests are good, and =
that it is the claims being  tested that are bogus.   I thin=
k it takes a lot of dancing to believe the former over the latter.<br>
<br>=
Again, being skeptical means not simply accepting  claims, especially =
unusual ones, without some critical thinking and investigation.  It do=
esn't mean that the claims deserve to be rejected outright, just as it does=
n't mean rejecting everything we know about history and science.  Ther=
e is nothing wrong with demanding evidence of unusual claims.  But not=
 just evidence: good evidence, evidence gathered under controlled condition=
s.  Personal claims about ghosts are not good evidence.  Recordin=
gs that can only be understood once someone is first told what they are sup=
posed to hear, is not good evidence.  The only good evidence we have a=
re the claims where the recordings are said to predict something: and then =
that something doesn't happen.  Unfortunately, that is good evidence t=
hat this is just random sounds, not that their is any intelligence lying to=
 us.<br>
<br>Notice also, that if I am a skeptic, I do not need to call tho=
se who are not skeptical, or are convinced that their are ghosts on their r=
adio, names or other insulting things.  I do not feel the need to be d=
efensive, because I have nothing to defend.  I just ask for, look for,=
 and wait for, better evidence.  Nothing would make me happier to find=
 proof of an afterlife, beyond just claims and televangelists and shows on =
tv.  That's why I comment about claims of proof that I don't think hol=
d water. Because I think real proof is important.  And bogus proof is =
the primary obstacle to finding the good stuff.<br>
